variants.Description in input context: The identified variant (NM_003382.3:c.379G>A) in the PARK2 gene was found to cause a change in the protein sequence, affecting its interaction with other proteins.

Material used.Description: The study utilized patient-derived fibroblasts to investigate the impact of the genetic variant on the expression of parkin.

Readout description.Result Description: The immunoblotting analysis revealed a significant reduction in parkin protein levels in fibroblasts carrying the identified variant (NM_003382.3:c.379G>A). The reduction was approximately 60% compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent patient-derived fibroblast lines were analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type parkin cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector served as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Parkin protein expression > 80% compared to controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Parkin protein expression < 50% compared to controls.
